name: overlay
description: Overlay is a positionable and stackable widget, which also provides support for the standard module format layout, with a header, body and footer section.
author: ericf
sdesai

examples.name: overlay-xy
examples.description: Shows how to instantiate a basic Overlay instance, and use the Overlay's basic XY positioning support.

examples.name: overlay-tooltip
examples.description: Shows how to create a simple tooltip incorporating the overlay shim feature.

examples.name: overlay-align
examples.description: Shows how to use the Overlay's XY alignment support, to align the Overlay relative to another element, or to the viewport.

examples.name: overlay-stack
examples.description: Shows how to use the Overlay's zindex and shim support when positioning Overlays above other elements on the page.

examples.name: overlay-stdmod
examples.description: Shows how to modify content in the Overlay's header, body and footer sections.

examples.name: overlay-constrain
examples.description: Shows how to use Overlay's constrainment support, to limit the XY value which can be set for an Overlay.

examples.name: overlay-io-plugin
examples.description: Shows how to create a simple plugin to retrieve content for the Overlay using the io utility.

examples.name: overlay-anim-plugin
examples.description: Shows how to create a simple plugin to animate the Overlay's movement and visibility.
